messages.messageBody:
Alas, it was checked out from our library this week! And I couldn't find
"practical Cats" either!
Susan

Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Hey, RumpleTeaserMom

> wrong.
> Joanna

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Hey, RumpleTeaserMom
messages.msgSnippet: ... Thanks!   I ll add that to the library list,  too! Susan
messages.messageBody:
> Jellicle Cats come out tonight . . .
>
> You might be interested in TS Elliot's Book of Practical Cats. It'a a
> book of cat poems that formed the basis for the musical Cats.
>
> Bridget
Thanks! I'll add that to the library list, too!
Susan

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Hey, RumpleTeaserMom
messages.msgSnippet: ... the ... Thanks,  Joyce! I m sure that s it.   It was part of a variety CD we d gotten.    ANd being uncultivated ,  I suppose,  I have somehow managed
messages.messageBody:
> I'm not sure what you're not finding, but the Jellicle cat song is from
the
> Cats musical and readily available on CD (and VHS and DVD and books and
...
> ;-)
>
> And if you type "jellicle cat" into http://www.google.com you'll get some
> related webpages :-)

Thanks, Joyce!
I'm sure that's it. It was part of a 'variety' CD we'd gotten. ANd
being 'uncultivated', I suppose, I have somehow managed to never see Cats
in any form....live, movie, etc. I'll chack it out on DVD soon.
Susan, adding Cats to library list.

messages.subject: Re: Hey, RumpleTeaserMom
messages.msgSnippet: Jellicle Cats come out tonight . . . You might be interested in TS Elliot s Book of Practical Cats.  It a a book of cat poems that formed the basis for the
messages.messageBody:
Jellicle Cats come out tonight . . .

You might be interested in TS Elliot's Book of Practical Cats. It'a a
book of cat poems that formed the basis for the musical Cats.

Bridget

--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Joseph Fuerst" <fuerst@f...> wrote:
> Speaking of cats......and try to bear with me on being a bit behind
:-)

musical

DDs love
> the song which we heard on a library CD with children in musicals,
but
> can't seem to find it lately.
> Susan

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Hey, RumpleTeaserMom
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m not sure what you re not finding, but the Jellicle cat song is from the Cats musical and readily available on CD (and VHS and DVD and books and ... ;-)
messages.messageBody:
on 3/25/02 5:16 PM, Joseph Fuerst at fuerst@... wrote:

> Speaking of cats......and try to bear with me on being a bit behind :-)
> ...... what's the story behind jellicle cats?? There's a song in a musical
> (is it cats?) the talks about jellicle songs for jellicle cats. DDs love
> the song which we heard on a library CD with children in musicals, but
> can't seem to find it lately.

I'm not sure what you're not finding, but the Jellicle cat song is from the
Cats musical and readily available on CD (and VHS and DVD and books and ...
;-)

And if you type "jellicle cat" into http://www.google.com you'll get some
related webpages :-)

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: Hey, RumpleTeaserMom
messages.msgSnippet: We have Cats on video, and my kids love it.  Esp. my 5 and 2yo. I got it off of e bay. In the song, they describe what a jelical cat is.  I can t remember
messages.messageBody:
We have "Cats" on video, and my kids love it. Esp. my 5 and 2yo.
I got it off of e bay.
In the song, they describe what a jelical cat is. I can't remember
all the criteria. There are also, Gumby cats. I think it's all made
up for the musical and not applied to real life cats. But I could be
wrong.
Joanna

but

> Susan

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Hey, RumpleTeaserMom
messages.msgSnippet: Speaking of cats......and try to bear with me on being a bit behind :-) ...... what s the story behind jellicle cats??   There s a song in a musical (is it
messages.messageBody:
Speaking of cats......and try to bear with me on being a bit behind :-)
...... what's the story behind jellicle cats?? There's a song in a musical
(is it cats?) the talks about jellicle songs for jellicle cats. DDs love
the song which we heard on a library CD with children in musicals, but
can't seem to find it lately.
Susan

messages.msgSnippet: ... It s the book the musical Cats is based on.  So you might want to rent the video too.  It s interesting to see what they changed and speculate why they
messages.messageBody:
on 3/21/02 9:48 PM, Katy Clark at katyclark1969@... wrote:

> Very interesting!! I love cats and will have to read that one. Thanks!!

It's the book the musical Cats is based on. So you might want to rent the
video too. It's interesting to see what they changed and speculate why they
did. :-)

Joyce

messages.messageBody:
Very interesting!! I love cats and will have to read that one. Thanks!!
Katy
rumpleteasermom <rumpleteasermom@...> wrote: Rumpleteaser is a cat in T.S.Elliots Book of Practical Cats. Jenni
chose Jennyanydots for here screen name which is another of his cats.
She actually suggested Rumpleteaser for me since is was taken we
added mom to the end (we set our accounts up on the same day.)

Bridget

wrote:
> I'm just wonder what the significance of your call-
> sign, "RumpleTeaserMom" is? It's almost as good as Life-is-good
> Mary's!!
>
> Katy
